## Use diagnostic plots to check model

```{r}
full_model = lm(le ~ year + status_Developed + adult_mort + infantdeaths + alcohol + percent_exp + hepatitis_b_high + hepatitis_b_low + measles + bmi + under_five + polio_high + polio_low + total_exp + diphtheria_high + diphtheria_low + hiv_aids + gdp + population + thin_1_19 + thin_5_9 + HDI + schooling, data = le_df)
summary(full_model)
check_collinearity(full_model)

## remove high correlation and insignificant variables
full_model = lm(le ~ status_Developed + adult_mort + infantdeaths + bmi + polio_high + diphtheria_low + hiv_aids + gdp + HDI + schooling, data = le_df)
summary(full_model)

par(mfrow = c(2, 2))

#Residuals vs Fitted values Plot

```

## Box-cox Transformation
```{r}
bc = boxcox(full_model)
lambda = bc$x[which.max(bc$y)]
lambda

le_df =
  le_df %>% 
  mutate(bc_le = (le)^2)

full_bc = lm(bc_le ~ status_Developed + adult_mort + infantdeaths + bmi + polio_high + diphtheria_low + hiv_aids + gdp + HDI + schooling, data = le_df)
summary(full_bc)

full = lm(le ~ status_Developed + adult_mort + infantdeaths + bmi + polio_high + diphtheria_low + hiv_aids + gdp + HDI + schooling, data = le_df)
summary(full)

par(mfrow = c(2, 1))
par(mar = c(2,2,2,2))

plot(full_bc, which = 1)  
plot(full, which = 1)

plot(full_bc, which = 2)  
plot(full, which = 2)

plot(full_bc, which = 3)  
plot(full, which = 3)

plot(full_bc, which = 5)  
plot(full, which = 5)

par(mfrow = c(1, 1)) 
par(mar = c(3,3,3,3))
```

## Identify influentical observations

```{r}
plot(full_bc, which = 5)

# Identify influential observations using Cook's distance
cutoff <- 4/nrow(le_df)
plot(full_bc, which = 4, cook.levels = cutoff)
abline(h = cutoff, lty = 2, col = "red")

cook = cooks.distance(full_bc)
influential_obs = as.numeric(names(cook)[(cook > cutoff)])

#define new data frame with influential points removed
no_influ_le = le_df[-influential_obs, ]

no_influ_full_bc = lm(bc_le ~ status_Developed + adult_mort + infantdeaths + bmi + polio_high + diphtheria_low + hiv_aids + gdp + HDI + schooling, data = no_influ_le)
summary(no_influ_full_bc)
```

## Leverage checking 

```{r}
# compare models with and without influential observations
no_influ_full_bc = lm(bc_le ~ status_Developed + adult_mort + infantdeaths + bmi + polio_high + diphtheria_low + hiv_aids + gdp + HDI + schooling, data = no_influ_le)
summary(no_influ_full_bc)

full_bc = lm(bc_le ~ status_Developed + adult_mort + infantdeaths + bmi + polio_high + diphtheria_low + hiv_aids + gdp + HDI + schooling, data = le_df)
summary(full_bc)
```

## Multi-collinearity

```{r}
check_collinearity(no_influ_full_bc)

# remove high correlation variables (HDI)
final_full = lm(bc_le ~ status_Developed + adult_mort + bmi + polio_high + diphtheria_low + hiv_aids + gdp + HDI + schooling, data = no_influ_le)
check_collinearity(final_full)
summary(final_full)
```

## Model Validation

```{r}
set.seed(1)

# Use 5-fold validation and create the training sets
train = trainControl(method = "cv", number = 5)

# Fit the 4-variables model
model = train(bc_le ~ status_Developed + adult_mort + bmi + polio_high + diphtheria_low + hiv_aids + gdp + HDI + schooling, data = no_influ_le, trControl = train, method = 'lm', na.action = na.pass)

model$finalModel
print(model)
```

## normalized RMSE

```{r}
rmse = model$results$RMSE / (max(no_influ_le$bc_le) - min(no_influ_le$bc_le))
rmse
```
